customer_name: Ervin Miller Marcus Miller Anna May Miller
site_name: Ervin Miller Marcus Miller Anna Mary Miller

citations.narrative:
Exterior areas of the wall under flapper doors on the north side and an area on the south side have areas of rust that
show exposed wood. This is an area that dogs can contact. Excessive rust can have rough/sharp edges and also can no
longer be cleaned and sanitized well. Ensure to repair/replace these areas.
***Correct by June 21, 2023.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The areas under the outdoor runs have excessive accumulation of waste material under them. The odors from under
these areas were stronger outside and was affecting the indoor air quality. Lack of frequent cleaning under the outdoor
runs can cause odors and areas for flies to nest on. To protect animal health, areas under
the outdoor runs need to be cleaned more often to prevent build-up of material.
***Correct by June 10, 2023.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The larger outdoor enclosure areas that different groups of dogs rotate through have grass grown up (higher than my
knees) to the point that it is difficult to observe dogs when they are out in it and cleaning up after the dogs would be very
difficult. Grass in the larger outdoor enclosures must be controlled in a way that enables cleaning of the area and to
observe the dogs so as to be able to promptly identify abnormal behavior/health in dogs.
***Correct by June 16, 2023.

It has been more than 12 months since adult dogs in the kennel got a complete head to tail physical exam by the
attending veterinarian. A complete physical exam by the attending veterinarian for each adult dog is important to ensure
each dog is healthy. Ensure that each adult dog gets a complete head to tail physical exam by the attending veterinarian.
***Correct by August 10, 2023.

The written program of veterinary care indicates heartworm prevention and intestinal parasite prevention, however does
not indication a schedule of sampling/testing for adult dogs. Regular heartworm and fecal tests on adult dogs can help
protect the health of the animals in the facility . Ensure to contact the attending veterinarian to get the written program of
veterinary care updated to indicate how many dogs per year should have heartworm tests and fecal samples taken.
***Correct by July 31, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.1(c)(1)(i) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
Exterior areas of the wall under flapper doors on the north side and an area on the south side have areas of rust that 
show exposed wood.  This is an area that dogs can contact.  Excessive rust can have rough/sharp edges and also can no 
longer be cleaned and sanitized well.  Ensure to repair/replace these areas.  
***Correct by June 21, 2023. 
3.11(a) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
The areas under the outdoor runs have excessive accumulation of waste material under them.  The odors from under 
these areas were stronger outside and was affecting the indoor air quality.  Lack of frequent cleaning under the outdoor 
runs can cause odors and areas for flies to nest on.  To protect animal health, areas under  
the outdoor runs need to be cleaned more often to prevent build-up of material.  
***Correct by June 10, 2023. 
3.11(c) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.

The larger outdoor enclosure areas that different groups of dogs rotate through have grass grown up (higher than my 
knees) to the point that it is difficult to observe dogs when they are out in it and cleaning up after the dogs would be very 
difficult.  Grass in the larger outdoor enclosures must be controlled in a way that enables cleaning of the area and to 
observe the dogs so as to be able to promptly identify abnormal behavior/health  in dogs.  
***Correct by June 16, 2023. 
3.13(a)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
It has been more than 12 months since adult dogs in the kennel got a complete head to tail physical exam by the 
attending veterinarian.  A complete physical exam by the attending veterinarian for each adult dog is important to ensure 
each dog is healthy.  Ensure that each adult dog gets a complete head to tail physical exam by the attending veterinarian.  
***Correct by August 10, 2023. 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The written program of veterinary care indicates heartworm prevention and intestinal parasite prevention, however does 
not indication a schedule of sampling/testing for adult dogs.   Regular heartworm and fecal tests on adult dogs can help 
protect the health of the animals in the facility .  Ensure to contact the attending veterinarian to get the written program of 
veterinary care updated to indicate how many dogs per year should have heartworm tests and fecal samples taken.  
***Correct by July 31, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
